info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 28 at 3:45PM EDT until August 29 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM EDT this evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will continue to increase from the south as the day continues. South sides of piers will be especially dangerous. This includes but is not limited to the South beach and South Haven, Grand Haven State Park and Pere Marquette Park in Muskegon.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
